## Supported architectures and operating systems

IBM Edge Application Manager supports the following operating systems running on your raspberry

* Linux on ARM (32-bit), for example Raspberry Pi, running Raspbian buster or stretch
* Linux on ARM (64-bit), for example NVIDIA Jetson Nano, TX1, or TX2, running Ubuntu 18.x (bionic)

MicroSD flash card (32 GB preferred)

## Install Operating System

If you do not have a supported OS on your device, the easiest way to install and configure the OS for the raspberry is to use [Raspberry Pi Imager](https://www.raspberrypi.org/software/)

1) Start the Raspberry PI Imager
  ![Raspberry PI Imager](../images/raspberry-pi-imager.png)

2) Choose the OS of your choice (Raspberry PI OS Lite 32-Bit recommented)

3) Choose the MicroSD

4) Press CTRL-Shift-X to enter advanced settings
   * Set your hostname
   * Enable SSH
   * Configure WiFi
   * Set locale settings
  ![Advanced Settings](../images/imager-advanced.png)

5) Write the OS to the MicroSD card

6) Eject the MicroSD card and put it into your device

7) Boot your device

For the jetson device follow  the [Getting Started with Jetson Nano Developer Kit](https://developer.nvidia.com/embedded/learn/get-started-jetson-nano-devkit#intro)

## Docker

IBM Edge Application Manager requires a recent version of Docker on your device.
If not already done, follow the instructions to [Install Docker](https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/debian/)

A more easy way to install docker, run the following script
```
curl -sSL https://get.docker.com | sh
```

To run docker commands as non-root execute
```
sudo usermod -aG docker pi
```
don't forget to logoff/login to make the changes effective.

### If you are using the provided RHEL 7 VM please install docker through the following commands as root

We have docker preinstalled for you

<Accordion>
  <AccordionItem title="docker install done for you">

Switch to root
```
su root
usermod -aG wheel ibmuser
```

Install docker
```
sudo yum install -y yum-utils
sudo yum-config-manager \
     --add-repo \
     https://download.docker.com/linux/centos/docker-ce.repo
sudo yum install docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io
sudo usermod -aG docker ibmuser
sudo systemctl start docker
sudo chkconfig docker on
exit
```

  </AccordionItem>
</Accordion>
